intro: Hieracium extensum, commonly known as the common hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to Europe, Asia, and North Africa. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that consist of both ray and disk flowers. The plant typically grows in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils, reaching heights of up to 60 centimeters. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers range in color from yellow to orange. Hieracium extensum is known for its ability to thrive in a variety of environmental conditions, making it a common sight in many temperate regions.
